intro: Balaka kersteniana, commonly known as the Kersten's balaka, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in rocky or dry habitats. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in umbels with vibrant colors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Balaka kersteniana is considered a species of conservation concern.
